sub_title: Sales Assistant in EMEA (Europe Middle East Africa) Market
summary:
Five years of study and work experience as a sales assistant for a Japanese company targeting the European market have strongly confirmed an internationally-oriented job as the preferred career choice for me. I strive for an entry-level position in international company or organization to deploy the various cultural, social, organizational and communication skills that I have developed through my varied work experiences: in sales, retail, hospitality work, teaching, health and child care and internship in Japan.

I am an enthusiastic and committed graduate of Japanese studies who has experience in working in a professional Japanese institution and is keen to enter a career focused on my passion for Japanese society, presenting opportunities to work with similar minded people. 

Being passionate about helping people and improving my language and communicative skills, I am an active member in several Japan-related organisations in the Netherlands: NJV (Dutch-Japanese Association), Kazaguruma (Japanese Women's Club in The Hague), Nichiran Silvernet Foundation (health care organization for aged Japanese living in the Netherlands) and the Alumnikai of Leiden (association for Japanese studies graduates) to stay in contact with people interested in Japan, practice my Japanese and provide help for Japanese living in the Netherlands. 

I regularly take part in the activities held in these organisations and have numerous responsibilities. For example, because of my language proficiency in Japanese, English and Dutch language and academic background, I am often involved in helping provide information on the Dutch working and education system for members by translating Dutch documents to Japanese or English.

certifications.name: Japanese Language Proficiency Test (JLPT) Level 1
certifications.authority: 日本語能力試験１級 The Japan Foundation

organizations.name: Alumni Kai of Leiden: "Van hier tot Tokio"

profile_positions.location: Amsterdam World Trade Center, The Netherlands
profile_positions.title: Sales  Assistant in EMEA (Europe Middle East Africa) Market

profile_positions.location: Digital manga distributor Amimaru's main company is located in Helsinki, Finland
profile_positions.description:
Company Description: Amimaru Ltd is a manga translation and publishing company that currently publishes digital manga through its iPad and Facebook applications. The company aims to distribute manga from a wide variety of companies, eliminating the need for consumers to use multiple services for their online manga reading needs. 

Job Description: Translating Japanese manga (from a variety of genres) into English. I am a localizing type of translator (localizers adapt text for a product or service from one language into another, a task known as localization). As a localization specialists I work to make it appear as though the product originated in the country where it will be sold. I convert concepts in the source language to equivalent concepts in the target language and relay the style and tone of the original language.
profile_positions.title: Freelance Japanese Translator

company.name: Nichiran Silvernet (organization for aged Japanese in the Netherlands)

profile_positions.company: Nichiran Silvernet (organization for aged Japanese in the Netherlands)
profile_positions.description:
Nichiran Silvernet is a Foundation that provides help to aged Japanese people living in the Netherlands who are in need of health care services.
As a volunteer my principal activities include: provide computer help, give information on Dutch culture, translate Dutch documents into Japanese and visiting members to provide some company and inquire how they are.
profile_positions.title: Volunteer

profile_positions.description: Since I was 14 years old I have been babysitting the children (infants to teenagers) of some neighbourhood families amongst which Japanese expat families.
profile_positions.title: Babysitter (including Japanese expat families)

profile_positions.description: I performed in-home assisted living health care services for an elderly single woman living in my neighborhood. I helped her with physically demanding jobs, such as shopping, cleaning, gardening, and provided her with some company and conversation.
profile_positions.title: Home Health Care Employee

profile_positions.description:
The Kyoto International Manga Museum acts as a venue for the collection, preservation and exhibition of manga and animation materials. 

As an intern I offered assistance in a day-to-day functioning of the economic, commercial and research departments within the museum. Principal activities included: Guiding Japanese and foreign tourists, translating research materials and guide books, archiving promotional materials on exhibitions and events, helping with the administration and promotion of the museum and carrying out individual tasks such as organizing small events and writing an evaluation report on the museum's strong and weak points.
profile_positions.title: Internship

company.name: Grocery Shop, Theresia Groente en Fruit

profile_positions.company: Grocery Shop, Theresia Groente en Fruit
profile_positions.description: In the grocery shop I gave advice and guidance on product selection to customers, stocked the shelves, balanced cash registers with receipts and kept the store tidy and clean. I enjoyed engaging in conversation with the customers and answering their queries on the products sold at the shop.
profile_positions.title: Salesperson

profile_positions.description: As a student mentor I prepared and conducted class activities with first year students. In class I discussed learning strategies, answered general and academic queries and created language exercises.
profile_positions.title: Student Mentor for first-year students

volunteer_experiences.description: Nichiran Silvernet is a foundation that provides help to aged Japanese people living in the Netherlands who are in need of health care services, but also organizes activities (dance and singing lessons, workshops, picnics, lectures, etc) and provides information on living and working in the Netherlands.
